In that day. Isa. 28:5-6 is parenthetical and prophesies of the last days, when a remnant of Israel will consider the Lord to be a crown of beauty.

shall the Lord…be for a crown of glory/diadem of beauty. In contrast to the crown of pride in 28:1 and 3, the Lord—the true king—is both beautiful and glorious to his people (2:11; 4:2). This passage also alludes to the temple and the promise that the Lord's saints may receive a crown of glory at his right hand (D&C 104:7).

residue of his people. The remnant of Israel, which will be gathered in the last days (24:13; 27:12-13).
